episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the eccentricities of the first chief of MI6, the impact of music on whiskey aging, a statue of Nikola Tesla that provides free Wi-Fi, and the decline of handwriting in Britain.

facts.fact: According to the diary of the first chief of MI6, this is how the first day went: Went to the office, saw no one, nor was there anything to do there.
There is a distillery in Kentucky that claims that playing Bruce Springsteen to the whiskey improves the aging process.
There is a statue of Nikola Tesla in Silicon Valley that radiates free Wi-Fi.
A third of people in Britain have written almost nothing by hand in the last six months.
